Research

Research Experience

My research experiences in reverse chronological order

Institute for Geoinformatics, University of Münster, Germany

(April, 2018 - present)

Working as an assistant in Spatio-Temporal Modelling Lab headed by Prof. Dr. Edzer Pebesma and contributing towards the project “openEO”. More details on the project can be found on its official website http://openeo.org. My responsibilities include developing the necessary infrastructure for running user-defined custom functions written in R on Earth Observation data in cloud backends.

Link to Github organization for openEO: https://github.com/Open-EO. Link to the Github repositories I am contributing to in the context of this project (work in progress):

  • pramitghosh/OpenEO.R.UDF, Docker

  • Open-EO/openeo-r-backend, Docker

  • Projects contributing to:
    • “openEO - A Common, Open Source Interface between Earth Observation Data Infrastructures and Front-End Applications” (OpenEO) funded under European Union’s Horizon 2020 program

School of Oceanographic Studies, Jadavpur University, India

(January, 2016 - March, 2017)

Worked as an assistant and participated actively in ongoing research in domains spanning ecology (Land Use Land Cover modelling, ecosystem services modelling), oceanography (coastal dynamics, vulnerability of coastal communities due to natural phenomenon) and fisheries (predictive species modelling)

  • Projects contributed to:
    • “Assessing health, livelihoods, ecosystem services and poverty alleviation in populous deltas” (ESPA Deltas) funded by Department for International Development (DFID), Economic and Social Research Council (ESRC) and Natural Environment Research Council (NERC) under Living with Environmental Change Programme (LWEC) of the UK.
    • “DEltas, vulnerability & Climate Change: Migration & Adaptation (DECCMA)” funded by the UK Government’s Department for international Development (DFID) and International Development Research Centre (IDRC), Canada under the Collaborative Adaptation Research Initiative in Africa and Asia (CARIAA) program.
    • “Bio Optical Studies and Ecological Modelling in Case II water of West Bengal Coast towards Hilsa Fishery Forecast” funded by ESSO - Indian National Centre for Ocean Information Services (INCOIS), Government of India

Publications

Articles in international peer-reviewed journals

  • Abhra Chanda, Sourav Das, Anirban Mukhopadhyay, Amit Ghosh, Anirban Akhand, Pramit Ghosh, Tuhin Ghosh, Debashis Mitra, and Sugata Hazra. “Sea surface temperature and rainfall anomaly over the Bay of Bengal during the El Niño-Southern Oscillation and the extreme Indian Ocean Dipole events between 2002 and 2016.” Remote Sensing Applications: Society and Environment 12 (2018): 10-22. (Elsevier) DOI: 10.1016/j.rsase.2018.08.001

  • Anirban Mukhopadhyay, Pramit Ghosh, Abhra Chanda, Amit Ghosh, Subhajit Ghosh, Shouvik Das, Tuhin Ghosh, and Sugata Hazra. “Threats to coastal communities of Mahanadi delta due to imminent consequences of erosion - Present and near future.” Science of the Total Environment 637 (2018): 717-729. (Elsevier) DOI: 10.1016/j.scitotenv.2018.05.076

  • Pramit Ghosh, Anirban Mukhopadhyay, Abhra Chanda, Parimal Mondal, Anirban Akhand, Sandip Mukherjee, S. K. Nayak, Subhajit Ghosh, Debasish Mitra, Tuhin Ghosh, and Sugata Hazra. “Application of Cellular automata and Markov-chain model in geospatial environmental modeling - A review.” Remote Sensing Applications: Society and Environment 5 (2017): 64-77. (Elsevier) DOI: 10.1016/j.rsase.2017.01.005

Manuscripts in preparation

  • Sandip Giri, Sugata Hazra, Pramit Ghosh, Amit Ghosh, Sourav Das, Abhra Chanda, Isha Das, Kunal Chakraborty, Anirban Mukhopadhyay, and Sourav Maity. “Role of lunar phases, rainfall and wind in predicting Hilsa shad (Tenualosa ilisha) catch in the northern Bay of Bengal.” Manuscript submitted and under review for publication (2018).

Conference papers

  • Pramit Ghosh, Florian Lahn, Sören Gebbert, Matthias Mohr, and Edzer Pebesma. “Running userdefined functions in R on Earth observation data in cloud back-ends.” Geomundus, 2018 in Lisbon, Portugal during 7-8 December, 2018. Paper

Posters (Selected)

  • Pramit Ghosh, and Anirban Mukhopadhyay. “A modified equation to calculate the potential future shoreline position using transects.” (2018). Poster presented in European Geosciences Union General Assembly 2018 at Vienna, Austria in the session “Coastal zone geomorphologic interactions: natural versus human-induced driving factors (co-organized)” (GM11.4/NH11.16) during 8-13 April, 2018. Abstract

Presentations

  • Presented “Running user-defined functions in R on Earth observation data in cloud back-ends” at Geomundus, 2018 in Lisbon, Portugal held on 7th and 8th December, 2018. Slides

Journal Referee

  • Journal of Hydrology

Teaching

  • Tutor for the course “Reference Systems” at the Institute for Geoinformatics, University of Münster in the Summer Semester, 2018 meant for BSc Geoinformatik, MSc Geoinformatics and Erasmus Mundus MSc in Geospatial Technologies. Responsibilities include preparing teaching materials for practical classes, conducting Lab Sessions and evaluating quizzes.

  • Tutor for the study project “Monitoring Conflict Areas with Satellite Image Time Series” (Winter Semester, 2018/19) taught by Dr. Christian Knoth and Prof. Dr. Edzer Pebesma by attending to students’ queries and troubleshooting problems with programming. This course was meant for BSc Geoinformatik and MSc Geoinformatics students.

Honours

  • Outstanding Reviewer for Journal of Hydrology awarded in September, 2018 “in recognition of the contributions made to the quality of the journal” by its editors.

  • Travel grant of 500 € to attend the 10th Geomundus symposium at Universidade Nova de Lisboa in Lisbon, Portugal during 7-8th December, 2018 sponsored by Association of Geographic Information Laboratories in Europe (AGILE).
